item.title: 俄罗斯副总理诺瓦克本周将访华
item.description:
Russian Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak, President Vladimir Putin's top oil and gas point man, will head a Russian delegation to China for participation in an inter governmental commission on energy, the government said on Monday.翻译:政府周一表示，俄罗斯副总理亚历山大·诺瓦克、总统弗拉基米尔·普京的石油和天然气最高负责人将率领俄罗斯代表团前往中国参加政府间能源委员会。

It said without elaboration that the delegation of up to 20 officials will visit China on Dec. 12-16.翻译:报道称，由20名官员组成的代表团将于12月12日至16日访问中国，但没有详细说明。

China has become one of Russia's main trade partner and together with India buys a bulk of Russian oil exports, which Moscow has redirected from Europe following sanctions imposed on Russia after the start of the conflict in Ukraine in February 2022.翻译:中国已成为俄罗斯的主要贸易伙伴之一，并与印度一起购买了俄罗斯出口的大部分石油。2022 年 2 月乌克兰冲突爆发后对俄罗斯实施制裁后，莫斯科已将这些石油从欧洲转移出去。

Russia also seeks to boost its natural gas supplies to China to around 100 billion cubic metres (bcm) per year by 2030 from more than 22 bcm expected to be shipped via the Power of Siberia 1 pipeline this year.翻译:俄罗斯还寻求到 2030 年将其对中国的天然气供应量从今年通过西伯利亚力量 1 号管道输送的超过 22 立方米增加到每年约 1000 亿立方米 (bcm)。

Moscow has been engaged for painstaking talks with China over the Power of Siberia 2 pipeline, designed to carry Russian natural gas from northern Siberia - a source base for dwindling deliveries to Europe - to China via Mongolia.翻译:莫斯科一直在与中国就西伯利亚力量2号管道进行艰苦谈判，该管道旨在将俄罗斯天然气从西伯利亚北部（欧洲天然气供应量不断减少的来源基地）经蒙古输送到中国。

Reporting by Vladimir Soldatkin; Editing by Sandra Maler翻译:弗拉基米尔·索尔达特金报道；桑德拉·马勒编辑

item.title: 消息人士称，中国领导人开会讨论2024年的增长目标
item.description:
China's leaders started a closed-door meeting on Monday to discuss economic targets and map out stimulus plans for 2024, four sources familiar with the matter said.翻译:四位知情人士称，中国领导人周一召开闭门会议，讨论经济目标并制定 2024 年刺激计划。

The annual Central Economic Work Conference, during which President Xi Jinping and other top officials chart the course for the world's second-largest economy next year, is likely to end on Tuesday, the sources said.翻译:消息人士称，一年一度的中央经济工作会议可能于周二结束，习近平主席和其他高级官员将在会上为世界第二大经济体制定明年的发展方向。

Investors are closely watching for clues on next year's policy and reform agenda as China's economy has struggled to mount a strong post-pandemic recovery amid the deepening housing crisis, local government debt concerns, slowing global growth and geopolitical tensions.翻译:由于房地产危机加剧、地方政府债务担忧、全球经济增长放缓和地缘政治紧张局势，中国经济在疫情后难以实现强劲复苏，投资者正在密切关注明年政策和改革议程的线索。

The Politburo, a top decision-making body of the ruling Communist Party, said on Friday that fiscal policy would be moderately strengthened and will be "flexible, moderate, precise, and effective", to help spur the economic recovery.翻译:执政的共产党的最高决策机构政治局周五表示，财政政策将适度加强，将“灵活适度、精准有效”，以帮助刺激经济复苏。

A flurry of policy support measures have proven only modestly beneficial, raising pressure on authorities to roll out more stimulus.翻译:事实证明，一系列政策支持措施的效果有限，这加大了当局推出更多刺激措施的压力。

China's government advisers have told Reuters that they would recommend economic growth targets for 2024 ranging from 4.5% to 5.5%, with the majority favouring a target of around 5% - the same as this year.翻译:中国政府顾问告诉路透社，他们建议2024年的经济增长目标为4.5%至5.5%，其中大多数人赞成5%左右的目标——与今年相同。

"We are likely to set a growth target of around 5%," said a policy insider who spoke on condition of anonymity. "We need to step up policy support for the economy."翻译:“我们可能会设定5%左右的增长目标，”一位不愿透露姓名的政策内部人士表示。 “我们需要加大对经济的政策支持。”

China's state council, or cabinet, could not immediately be reached for comment outside business hours.翻译:在工作时间之外，未能立即联系到中国国务院置评。

Analysts at Citi expect China to set a fiscal deficit target of 3.8% of gross domestic product, or 3% of GDP on top of 1 trillion yuan ($139.32 billion) in special treasury bonds, and a special local government bond quota of 3.8 trillion yuan.翻译:花旗分析师预计，除了1万亿元人民币（1,393.2亿美元）的特别国债和3.8万亿元人民币的特别地方政府债券额度之外，中国还将设定财政赤字目标为国内生产总值的3.8%，即GDP的3% 。

In October, China unveiled a plan to issue 1 trillion yuan in sovereign bonds by the end of the year, raising the 2023 budget deficit target to 3.8% of gross domestic product (GDP) from the original 3%.翻译:10月，中国公布了年底前发行1万亿元人民币主权债券的计划，将2023年预算赤字目标从原来占国内生产总值(GDP)的3%提高到3.8%。

Although key economic targets are expected to be endorsed at the meeting, they will not be announced publicly until China's annual parliament meeting, usually held in March.翻译:尽管主要经济目标预计将在会议上获得通过，但要到通常在三月份举行的中国年度人大会议之前才会公开宣布。

Last week Ratings agency Moody's slapped a downgrade warning on China's credit rating, saying costs to bail out debt-laden local governments and state firms and control its property crisis would weigh on the growth outlook of the economy.翻译:上周，评级机构穆迪对中国信用评级发出下调警告，称救助负债累累的地方政府和国有企业以及控制房地产危机的成本将给经济增长前景带来压力。

China's growth is see on track to hit the government's target of around 5% this year.翻译:中国今年的经济增长有望实现政府设定的 5% 左右的目标。

($1 = 7.1775 Chinese yuan renminbi)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.1775 人民币）

Reporting by Reuters staff; Editing by Alex Richardson翻译:路透社工作人员的报道；亚历克斯·理查森编辑

item.title: 联合国特使在前往加沙边境时表示战争“够了”
item.description:
U.N. Security Council envoys spoke of unimaginable suffering and urged an end to the war in the Gaza Strip on Monday as they visited the Egyptian side of the Rafah border crossing, the besieged Palestinian enclave's only entry point for aid.翻译:联合国安理会特使周一在访问拉法过境点的埃及一侧时谈到了难以想象的痛苦，并敦促结束加沙地带的战争，拉法过境点是被围困的巴勒斯坦飞地唯一的援助入口。

China's representative to the United Nations, Zhang Jun, asked by reporters if he had a message to nations which opposed a ceasefire in Gaza, said simply: "Enough is enough."翻译:中国驻联合国代表张军被记者问及他是否有什么话要向反对加沙停火的国家传达，他简单地说：“够了。”

A majority of U.N. member states support an immediate and lasting ceasefire between Israel and the Palestinian militant group Hamas, which controls Gaza, as dire conditions worsen for its 2.3 million residents.翻译:大多数联合国成员国支持以色列和控制加沙的巴勒斯坦激进组织哈马斯之间立即实现持久停火，因为该地区 230 万居民的严峻状况正在恶化。

The United States, which backs Israel, last week vetoed a proposed Security Council demand for an immediate ceasefire as Israeli tanks and troops press an invasion that has displaced most of Gaza's population and killed more than 18,000 people.翻译:支持以色列的美国上周否决了安理会要求立即停火的提议，因为以色列坦克和军队的入侵导致加沙大部分人口流离失所，并造成超过 18,000 人死亡。

A dozen Security Council envoys attended the trip organised by the United Arab Emirates to visit Rafah, just days after Secretary-General Antonio Guterres warned that thousands of people in the besieged Palestinian enclave were "simply starving".翻译:十几名安理会特使参加了阿拉伯联合酋长国组织的访问拉法的行程，就在几天前，秘书长安东尼奥·古特雷斯警告说，被围困的巴勒斯坦飞地中的数千人“简直在挨饿”。

After flying to the town of Al-Arish they were briefed by U.N. Palestinian refugee agency UNRWA on conditions in Gaza before heading towards Rafah 30 miles (48 km) away.翻译:飞往阿里什镇后，他们听取了联合国巴勒斯坦难民机构近东救济工程处关于加沙情况的简报，然后前往 30 英里（48 公里）外的拉法。

"The reality is even worse than what words can speak," Ecuador's U.N. representative, Jose De La Gasca, told reporters after the UNRWA briefing.翻译:“现实比言语更糟糕，”厄瓜多尔联合国代表何塞·德拉加斯卡在近东救济工程处通报情况后告诉记者。

U.S. and France representatives did not participate in the trip.翻译:美国和法国代表没有参加此次访问。

UAE permanent representative to the U.N. Lana Nusseibeh said the envoys were told Gazans were dying from malnutrition, a collapsing medical system and a lack of water and food, in addition to the actual conflict in itself.翻译:阿联酋常驻联合国代表拉娜·努塞贝表示，特使们被告知，除了实际冲突本身之外，加沙人还因营养不良、崩溃的医疗系统以及缺乏水和食物而死亡。

Israel has bombarded Gaza from the air and from land, imposed a siege and mounted a ground offensive in retaliation for an Oct. 7 attack by Hamas that Israel says killed 1,200 people and saw 240 people taken hostage. Gaza health authorities say about 18,000 people have been killed by Israeli attacks, with 49,500 injured.翻译:以色列从空中和陆地轰炸加沙，实施围困并发动地面攻势，以报复哈马斯 10 月 7 日的袭击，以色列称这次袭击造成 1,200 人死亡，240 人被扣为人质。加沙卫生当局称，以色列袭击已造成约18,000 人死亡，49,500 人受伤。

The vast majority of the Palestinian enclave's 2.3 million people have been driven from their homes.

'HUNGER IS PREVAILING'

UNRWA chief Philippe Lazzarini described an "implosion of civil order" where Gazans who have not eaten for days looted aid distribution centres and stopped trucks on roads as they tried to secure supplies for their families.翻译:近东救济工程处负责人菲利普·拉扎里尼描述了“社会秩序的崩溃”，几天没有吃东西的加沙人抢劫了援助物资分发中心，并在道路上拦住卡车，试图为家人获取物资。

"There is not enough assistance," Lazzarini said. "Hunger is prevailing in Gaza... Most of the people are just sleeping on the concrete."翻译:“没有足够的援助，”拉扎里尼说。 “加沙地带普遍存在饥饿……大多数人都睡在水泥地上。”

Russian envoy Vasily Nebenzia described conditions in Gaza as “catastrophic" and said that those against a ceasefire should “face the reality and afford dignity to the Palestinians".翻译:俄罗斯特使瓦西里·内本齐亚将加沙的局势描述为“灾难性的”，并表示反对停火的人应该“面对现实并给予巴勒斯坦人尊严”。

Nebenzia rejected accusations it was hypocritical to condemn Israel when Moscow had invaded Ukraine.翻译:内本齐亚否认莫斯科入侵乌克兰时谴责以色列是虚伪的指控。

Limited humanitarian aid and fuel deliveries have crossed into Gaza via the Rafah crossing, but aid officials say it comes nowhere near to satisfying the most basic needs of Gazans.翻译:有限的人道主义援助和燃料运输已通过拉法过境点进入加沙，但援助官员表示，这远远不能满足加沙人最基本的需求。

As the U.N. envoys travelled towards the Rafah border, hundreds of aid trucks were parked along the road leading to the crossing, waiting to deliver humanitarian aid to Gaza.翻译:当联合国特使前往拉法边境时，数百辆援助卡车停在通往过境点的道路上，等待向加沙运送人道主义援助物资。

UAE's Nusseibeh said Abu Dhabi was coordinating with relevant authorities so that drinkable water could be pumped into Gaza from an Emirati-funded desalination plant in Egypt.翻译:阿联酋的努塞贝表示，阿布扎比正在与有关当局协调，以便可以将饮用水从阿联酋资助的埃及海水淡化厂泵入加沙。

While Israel has turned off the water to Gaza, it is also unclear if Gaza's infrastructure is capable of receiving the desalinated water after weeks of heavy Israeli bombardment.翻译:虽然以色列已经关闭了加沙的供水，但在以色列数周的猛烈轰炸后，还不清楚加沙的基础设施是否有能力接收淡化水。

The U.N. Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs said that 100 trucks carrying humanitarian supplies entered Gaza from Egypt on Sunday, the same number as the previous day.翻译:联合国人道主义事务协调办公室表示，周日有100辆载有人道主义物资的卡车从埃及进入加沙，数量与前一天相同。

It noted that was "well below" the daily average of 500 truckloads, including fuel, that entered every working day prior to Oct. 7.翻译:它指出，这“远低于”10 月 7 日之前每个工作日进入的每日平均 500 辆卡车装载量（包括燃料）。

A UNICEF employee, speaking to reporters on the condition of anonymity, said a logistics centre near Al-Arish was storing items Israel had banned from being sent into Gaza, including solar panels and an ultrasound machine. The employee said they were banned because they were electrical and contained metal.翻译:一名不愿透露姓名的联合国儿童基金会员工对记者表示，阿里什附近的一个物流中心正在储存以色列禁止运往加沙的物品，包括太阳能电池板和超声波机器。该员工表示，它们被禁止是因为它们是带电的且含有金属。

The 15-member Security Council is negotiating a UAE-drafted resolution that demands warring parties "allow the use of all land, sea and air routes to and throughout" Gaza for aid.翻译:由 15 名成员组成的安理会正在就阿联酋起草的一项决议进行谈判，该决议要求交战各方“允许使用通往和整个加沙的所有陆地、海上和空中航线”提供援助。

It would also establish a U.N.-run aid monitoring mechanism in Gaza Strip. It was not clear when the draft resolution could be put to a vote.翻译:它还将在加沙地带建立一个联合国管理的援助监测机制。目前尚不清楚该决议草案何时可以付诸表决。

Guterres last week formally warned the Security Council of the global threat to peace and security posed by the conflict.翻译:古特雷斯上周正式警告安理会，冲突对全球和平与安全构成威胁。

He said half of Gazans in the north of the territory and at least a third of those displaced in the south were "simply starving" and later criticised the council for having "failed" to help bring about a humanitarian ceasefire.翻译:他说，该领土北部一半的加沙人以及南部至少三分之一的流离失所者“只是在挨饿”，后来批评该委员会“未能”帮助实现人道主义停火。

The U.N. General Assembly will meet on Gaza on Tuesday at the request of Arab and Muslim states. The 193-member body is likely to vote on a draft resolution demanding an immediate humanitarian ceasefire, diplomats said.翻译:应阿拉伯和穆斯林国家的要求，联合国大会将于周二在加沙举行会议。外交官称，这个由 193 名成员组成的机构可能会对一项要求立即人道主义停火的决议草案进行投票。

Writing and additional reporting by Michelle Nichols, John Davison Editing by Angus MacSwan and Nick Macfie翻译:米歇尔·尼科尔斯 (Michelle Nichols) 撰写和补充报道，约翰·戴维森 (John Davison) 编辑：安格斯·麦克斯旺 (Angus MacSwan) 和尼克·麦克菲 (Nick Macfie)

item.title: 亚洲和非洲移民激增，亚马逊丛林前哨变成十字路口
item.description:
A recent crackdown on migrant smuggling and human trafficking throughout the Americas turned up migrants from 69 countries, an indicator of the steep growth in Asians and Africans who are crossing oceans and continents to reach the United States.翻译:最近美洲各地打击移民走私和人口贩运的行动发现了来自 69 个国家的移民，这表明跨越大洋和大陆前往美国的亚洲和非洲人数量急剧增加。

Coordinated by the international police organization Interpol, the fifth annual Operation Turquesa united immigration enforcement officers from throughout the Americas from Nov. 27 to Dec. 1 in an attempt to dismantle international crime syndicates.翻译:在国际警察组织国际刑警组织的协调下，第五届年度绿松石行动于11月27日至12月1日联合美洲各地的移民执法人员，试图瓦解国际犯罪集团。

Among the victories officials claimed were stopping a Portuguese national who was buying newborn babies from impoverished Brazilian women for sale in Europe, arresting three suspects linked to the notorious Venezuelan prison gang Tren de Aragua, and freezing $286,000 worth of assets belonging to a ring that recruited Brazilians to a cyber fraud center in Cambodia.翻译:官员们声称取得的胜利包括阻止一名葡萄牙国民从巴西贫困妇女那里购买新生婴儿并在欧洲出售，逮捕了三名与臭名昭著的委内瑞拉监狱帮派 Tren de Aragua 有关的嫌疑人，并冻结了一个招募新成员的团伙价值 286,000 美元的资产。巴西人前往柬埔寨的一个网络欺诈中心。

In its fifth annual Operation Turquesa, Interpol brought together law enforcement from 31 countries in the Americas, including Cuba for the first time, plus France and Spain. Together they netted 257 arrests, rescued 163 suspected victims of human trafficking and detected nearly 12,000 undocumented immigrants from 69 countries, Interpol said.翻译:在第五次年度“绿松石行动”中，国际刑警组织首次汇集了美洲 31 个国家的执法部门，其中首次包括古巴、法国和西班牙。国际刑警组织表示，他们总共逮捕了 257 人，解救了 163 名涉嫌人口贩运的受害者，并查获了来自 69 个国家的近 12,000 名无证移民。

Dozens of trafficking victims were children, including 12 in Honduras.翻译:数十名人口贩运受害者是儿童，其中 12 名来自洪都拉斯。

Sixty-nine countries is the highest number ever and is more than double the 28 countries reported in the first sweep in 2019.翻译:69 个国家是有史以来数量最多的，是 2019 年第一次扫描中报告的 28 个国家的两倍多。

Focused on migrants destined for the U.S. and Canada, this year's operation showed a "marked increase" in migrants from Asia and Africa, particularly from China, which was the third most popular country of origin behind Venezuela and Ecuador, Interpol said.翻译:国际刑警组织表示，今年的行动主要针对前往美国和加拿大的移民，显示来自亚洲和非洲的移民“显着增加”，特别是来自中国的移民，中国是仅次于委内瑞拉和厄瓜多尔的第三大最受欢迎的原籍国。

"The number of nationalities detected during Operation Turquesa V demonstrates how this major migration corridor, once considered a route reserved to the Americas, has become the target of organized crime groups from around the world," Interpol Secretary General Jurgen Stock said in a statement.翻译:国际刑警组织秘书长于尔根·斯托克在一份声明中表示：“绿松石五号行动中发现的国籍数量表明，这条曾经被认为是美洲保留路线的主要移民走廊如何成为世界各地有组织犯罪集团的目标。”

Migrants who cooperated with police provided insight into recruitment tactics, travel conditions and the cost of being smuggled, which ranged from $2,700 to $20,000 per person depending on the journey, Interpol said. Smugglers often have ties with the illicit drug trade, adding untold fortunes to gangsters already awash in cash.翻译:国际刑警组织表示，与警方合作的移民提供了有关招募策略、旅行条件和偷渡成本的深入信息，根据旅程的不同，偷渡成本从每人 2,700 美元到 20,000 美元不等。走私者经常与非法毒品贸易有联系，为已经现金充裕的歹徒增加了数不清的财富。

The number of migrants encountered at the U.S. border with Mexico from countries outside of Latin America and the Caribbean increased by 43% between the 2022 and 2023 fiscal years, according to CBP data.翻译:根据 CBP 的数据，2022 至 2023 财年，在美国与墨西哥边境遇到的来自拉丁美洲和加勒比海地区以外国家的移民数量增加了 43%。

In October, the first month of the 2024 fiscal year, there were nearly 12,000 migrants at the border from those "extracontinental" countries, nearly the same amount as arrived in all of 2021.翻译:10 月，即 2024 财年的第一个月，边境有近 12,000 名来自这些“洲外”国家的移民，几乎与 2021 年全年抵达的人数相同。

The U.S. Department of Homeland Security calls the current trend "the highest level of mass migration since World War II." U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) attributed it to "economic distress and political upheaval" triggered in part by natural disasters and a worldwide pandemic.

BRAZIL AS MIGRATION HUB

Operation Turquesa also offered a peek into Brazil's outsized role in the transcontinental trade, with migrants crisscrossing the country. Most were destined for the United States, others for Europe and some settled in Brazil itself, according to Brazil's Federal Police.翻译:绿松石行动还让人们一睹巴西在跨大陆贸易中的巨大作用，移民在全国各地穿梭。据巴西联邦警察称，大多数人的目的地是美国，其他人则前往欧洲，还有一些在巴西境内定居。

Federal Police deployed officers to nine points around Brazil, the fifth-largest nation in the world by area and one sharing a border with 10 other countries.翻译:联邦警察在巴西各地的九个地点部署了警力。巴西是世界上面积第五大的国家，并且与其他 10 个国家接壤。

Brazil has detected patterns such as migrants from Cuba and Haiti traveling to the tiny coastal nation of Guyana, then crossing illegally into Brazil and making a two-day overland journey to the Brazilian Amazon city of Manaus. There they begin a more than 1,000-kilometer (1,600-mile), weeklong riverboat journey up the Amazon to the jungle outpost of Tabatinga, on the border with Colombia and Peru.翻译:巴西发现了一些模式，例如来自古巴和海地的移民前往沿海小国圭亚那，然后非法越境进入巴西，并通过为期两天的陆路旅程前往巴西亚马逊城市马瑙斯。在那里，他们开始了为期一周、长达 1,000 多公里（1,600 英里）的河船之旅，沿亚马逊河而上，到达位于哥伦比亚和秘鲁边境的丛林前哨塔巴廷加。

Tabatinga also attracts migrants from elsewhere in the Caribbean basin who are destined for Europe, police said. In one route, Dominican Republic nationals obtain fake Colombian passports in Colombia, cross into Brazil at Tabatinga, then make the long journey to Sao Paulo, more than 2,000 miles (3,200 km) away, their last stop before Europe.翻译:警方表示，塔巴廷加还吸引了来自加勒比盆地其他地区前往欧洲的移民。在一条路线中，多米尼加共和国国民在哥伦比亚获得假哥伦比亚护照，从塔巴廷加进入巴西，然后长途跋涉前往 2,000 多英里（3,200 公里）外的圣保罗，这是他们前往欧洲之前的最后一站。

"We have this open arms (immigration) policy ... and we have some complicated neighbors regarding drug production and everything else," said Commissioner Cristiano Eloi, chief of Brazil's Federal Police enforcement for human trafficking and migrant smuggling.翻译:“我们有张开双臂的（移民）政策……而且我们的邻国在毒品生产和其他一切方面都存在复杂的情况，”巴西联邦警察负责人口贩运和偷运移民执法的局长克里斯蒂亚诺·埃洛伊（Cristiano Eloi）说。

"And we have these more than 16,000 kilometers, 10,000 miles of border with all these Latin American countries. So it makes it absolutely impossible to take care of each centimeter of our borders."翻译:“我们与所有这些拉丁美洲国家都有超过16,000公里、10,000英里的边界。因此，我们绝对不可能照顾好我们边界的每一厘米。”

Another Federal Police officer, speaking on condition of anonymity because he was not the official spokesperson, said many criminal suspects blend in with the migrants, who are often reluctant to cooperate. Moreover, Brazilian law prevents police from arresting people simply for immigration violations.翻译:另一位因不是官方发言人而不愿透露姓名的联邦警察表示，许多犯罪嫌疑人与移民混在一起，而移民往往不愿合作。此外，巴西法律禁止警察仅仅因为违反移民法而逮捕人。

With those limitations, Brazil arrested only three suspects in Turquesa, but it did free four trafficking victims: the two babies who were to be sold, plus two women who were stopped at Sao Paulo airport before going to Europe, Eloi said.翻译:埃洛伊说，由于这些限制，巴西在图尔克萨只逮捕了三名嫌疑人，但释放了四名人口贩运受害者：两名将被出售的婴儿，以及两名在前往欧洲之前在圣保罗机场被拦截的妇女。

"We are not going after the migrants," Eloi told Reuters. "We are going for the smuggler ... for the traffickers that are sending people to be exploited."翻译:埃洛伊告诉路透社：“我们不会追捕移民。” “我们正在追捕走私犯……追捕那些送人去受剥削的人贩子。”

Reporting by Daniel Trotta in Carlsbad, California; Additional reporting by Mica Rosenberg in New York; Editing by Mary Milliken and Cynthia Osterman翻译:丹尼尔·特罗塔 (Daniel Trotta) 在加利福尼亚州卡尔斯巴德的报道； Mica Rosenberg 在纽约的补充报道；玛丽·米利肯和辛西娅·奥斯特曼编辑

item.title: 菲律宾称军事首领在被中国船只撞毁的船上
item.description:
Summary:
  • Manila accuses China of firing water cannons, ramming ship
  • Top Philippine military leader was aboard one ship
  • Marcos says China's actions illegal, violate international law
  • United States tells China to stop 'dangerous' conduct
翻译:概括：
  • 马尼拉指责中国发射水炮、冲撞船只
  • 菲律宾最高军事领导人登上一艘船
  • 马科斯称中国的行为非法，违反国际法
  • 美国要求中国停止“危险”行为

The Philippines on Monday called the actions of Chinese vessels against its boats carrying out South China Sea resupply missions over the weekend - including one with a senior Philippine military official aboard - a "serious escalation".翻译:菲律宾周一称，中国船只对周末执行南海补给任务的中国船只的行动——其中包括一艘载有菲律宾高级军事官员的船只——是“严重升级”。

Manila accused the Chinese coastguard and maritime militia of repeatedly firing water cannons at its resupply boats, causing "serious engine damage" to one, and "deliberately" ramming another. Philippine Chief of Staff of the Armed Forces Romeo Brawner said he was onboard a vessel that was both sprayed with a water cannon and rammed.翻译:马尼拉指责中国海岸警卫队和海上民兵多次向其补给船发射高压水枪，造成其中一艘补给船“严重发动机损坏”，并“故意”撞击另一艘补给船。菲律宾武装部队参谋长罗密欧·布劳纳表示，他所乘坐的船只遭到水炮喷射和撞击。

"This is a serious escalation on the part of the agents of the People's Republic of China," Jonathan Malaya, spokesperson of the National Security Council, said in a press conference where officials showed images and videos of the water cannons and ramming.翻译:国家安全委员会发言人乔纳森·马来亚在新闻发布会上表示，“这是中华人民共和国特工的严重升级”。会上，官员们展示了高压水枪和撞击的图像和视频。

Brawner told Philippine radio station DZBB that he was unhurt and that he did not believe China knew he was onboard the boat.翻译:布劳纳告诉菲律宾广播电台 DZBB，他没有受伤，而且他不相信中国知道他在船上。

The Philippines has filed diplomatic protests and has summoned China's ambassador over its "aggressive" actions in the South China Sea, which a foreign ministry official said were a "threat to peace, good order and security".翻译:菲律宾已就其在南海的“侵略”行为提出外交抗议，并召见了中国大使，一名外交部官员表示，这是“对和平、良好秩序与安全的威胁”。

China's foreign ministry said on Monday it had lodged solemn representations and a strong protest with the Philippine side over what it said was a collision on Sunday.翻译:中国外交部周一表示，已就周日发生的撞船事件向菲律宾方面提出严正交涉和强烈抗议。

The Philippine vessels "ignored Chinese coastguard's warnings and insisted on rushing into" waters near the Second Thomas Shoal, ministry spokesperson Mao Ning told a news briefing, adding that China's operation was "professional, reasonable and legal".翻译:外交部发言人毛宁在新闻发布会上表示，菲律宾船只“无视中国海警的警告，执意闯入”仁爱礁附近海域，并补充说中方的行动“专业、合理、合法”。

The Philippine ships were attempting to resupply military personnel stationed on a warship run aground years ago for use as a base.翻译:菲律宾船只正试图为多年前搁浅的一艘用作基地的军舰上的军事人员提供补给。

Mao said the responsibility for the "current repeated emergencies" at the disputed shoal lay with the Philippine side, which "refused to tow away the illegally beached warships and attempted to reinforce them to achieve permanent occupation".翻译:毛泽东表示，争议浅滩“目前反复出现的紧急情况”的责任在于菲律宾方面，“拒绝拖走非法搁浅的军舰，并试图增援它们以实现永久占领”。

China urged the Philippines to stop its "maritime violations and provocations" and stop its "groundless attacks and smears" against China, she said.翻译:中方敦促菲律宾停止“海上侵犯和挑衅”，停止对中国的“无端攻击和抹黑”。

Jay Batongbacal, a Manila-based expert on maritime law, said the latest incidents were "clearly another incremental escalation".翻译:马尼拉海事法专家杰伊·巴通巴卡尔 (Jay Batongbacal) 表示，最近的事件“显然是又一次逐步升级”。

"The use of water cannon this time is not mere dousing but had forceful impact, deliberately causing damage to vessels. And harassment of the civilian convoy is another step up in their threats," Batongbacal said.

'DISSONANCE'

It was not the first time China has used water cannons against Philippine vessels undertaking resupply missions for troops on features Manila occupies in the South China Sea; in August, the Philippines delayed a resupply mission by two weeks after its boats were sprayed.翻译:这并不是中国第一次对在菲律宾占领的南海岛礁上执行部队补给任务的菲律宾船只使用高压水枪； 8月，菲律宾因船只遭到喷洒而将补给任务推迟了两周。

The maritime confrontation between the Philippines and China during the weekend comes less than a month after leaders of both nations met on the sidelines of an economic summit in San Francisco to formulate ways forward in the South China Sea.翻译:菲律宾和中国周末发生海上对抗，距离两国领导人在旧金山举行的经济峰会期间会面，制定南海问题的解决方案不到一个月。

"There is a dissonance between what is being said and promised with what's happening in the waters," Foreign Ministry spokesperson Teresita Daza said in the briefing on Monday.翻译:外交部发言人特雷西塔·达扎在周一的简报中表示：“所说的和承诺的与水域中发生的情况不一致。”

Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has increasingly complained about China's "aggressive" behaviour, and he has sought closer ties with its treaty ally the United States.翻译:菲律宾总统小费迪南德·马科斯越来越多地抱怨中国的“侵略性”行为，并寻求与其条约盟友美国建立更密切的关系。

China claims sovereignty over nearly the entire South China Sea, pointing to a line on its maps that cuts into the exclusive economic zones of Vietnam, the Philippines, Malaysia, Brunei and Indonesia. Taiwan, which China also claims as part of its territory, has said it does not accept Beijing's maps.翻译:中国声称对几乎整个南海拥有主权，并指出其地图上有一条线切入了越南、菲律宾、马来西亚、文莱和印度尼西亚的专属经济区。中国也声称台湾是其领土的一部分，台湾已表示不接受北京的地图。

The Permanent Court of Arbitration in 2016 said the line on China's maps has no legal basis, a ruling the United States supports, but Beijing rejects.翻译:2016年，常设仲裁法院表示，中国地图上的这条线没有法律依据，美国支持这一裁决，但北京拒绝。

The United States has called out China for interfering in the Philippines' maritime operations and undermining regional stability, and urged Beijing to stop "its dangerous and destabilising conduct" in the strategic waters.翻译:美国指责中国干涉菲律宾的海上行动并破坏地区稳定，并敦促北京停止在战略海域“ 危险和破坏稳定的行为” 。

It reaffirmed its commitment to the mutual defence pact between Washington and Manila, and called for stability after what it called China's "unsafe... operational behaviour," a Pentagon spokesperson said on Monday.翻译:五角大楼发言人周一表示，它重申了对华盛顿和马尼拉之间共同防御协定的承诺，并在称中国“不安全……行动行为”后呼吁稳定。

China's Mao said that the maritime disputes between China and the Philippines were an issue between the two countries and that "no third party has the right to intervene".翻译:中国毛泽东表示，中菲海上争端是两国之间的问题，“任何第三方无权干预”。

Reporting by Neil Jerome Morales and Mikhail Flores, and Liz Lee and Ethan Wang in Beijing; additional reporting by Susan Heavey in Washington; Editing by Kanupriya Kapoor and Gerry Doyle翻译:Neil Jerome Morales 和 Mikhail Flores 以及 Liz Lee 和 Ethan Wang 在北京的报道；苏珊·希维 (Susan Heavey) 在华盛顿的补充报道；卡努普里亚·卡普尔和格里·多伊尔编辑
item.author: Mikhail Flores, Karen Lema

item.title: 解释者：为什么中国和菲律宾不断为一个小浅滩而争斗
item.description:
The Philippines on Monday described the actions of Chinese vessels against its boats carrying out South China Sea resupply missions over the weekend as a "serious escalation".翻译:菲律宾周一称，中国船只周末对其执行南海补给任务的船只采取的行动是“严重升级”。

In the latest in a series of confrontations, Manila accused Chinese coast guard and maritime militia vessels of repeatedly firing water cannon at its resupply boats and deliberately ramming another near the Second Thomas Shoal.

HOW BAD HAS IT BECOME?

In recent years , Manila and Beijing have been embroiled in confrontations at the Second Thomas Shoal as China has become more assertive in pressing its maritime claims, alarming rival claimants and other states operating in the South China Sea, including the United States.翻译:近年来，随着中国在提出海洋主张方面变得更加自信，马尼拉和北京在仁爱礁卷入了对抗，这令其他声索国和包括美国在内的在南海活动的其他国家感到震惊。

China claims sovereignty over nearly the entire South China Sea, pointing to a line on its maps that cuts into the exclusive economic zones (EEZ) of Vietnam, the Philippines, Malaysia, Brunei and Indonesia. Taiwan, which China also claims as part of its territory, has said it does not accept Beijing's maps.翻译:中国声称对几乎整个南海拥有主权，并指出其地图上有一条线切入了越南、菲律宾、马来西亚、文莱和印度尼西亚的专属经济区（EEZ）。中国也声称台湾是其领土的一部分，台湾已表示不接受北京的地图。

While this was not the first time that China's coastguard vessels had fired water cannon at Philippine boats, the latest incident caused serious engine damage to one of the resupply vessels that it had to be towed back to the port preventing it from completing it mission.翻译:虽然这并不是中国海警船第一次向菲律宾船只发射高压水枪，但最近的事件导致其中一艘补给船发动机严重损坏，不得不被拖回港口，使其无法完成任务。

The Philippines military chief was onboard another boat which was also fired on by water cannoned and rammed while transporting food and water for Filipino soldiers living aboard the aging navy ship, BRP Sierra Madre.翻译:菲律宾军事首长所在的另一艘船在为居住在老化海军舰艇“BRP Sierra Madre”上的菲律宾士兵运送食物和水时也遭到水炮射击和撞击。

Sierre Madre was deliberately grounded by the Manila on the Second Thomas Shoal in 1999 to assert its sovereign rights over the atoll, that lies within the Philippines' EEZ.翻译:1999年，马尼拉号故意在仁爱礁搁浅，以维护其对位于菲律宾专属经济区内的环礁的主权。

Philippine Chief of Staff of the Armed Forces, General Romeo Brawner, told a radio interview he was unhurt and that he does not believe China knew he was on the boat. But Manila has summoned Beijing's ambassador and filed diplomatic protests over what it called China's "aggressive" actions that were a "threat to peace, good order and security".翻译:菲律宾武装部队参谋长罗密欧·布劳纳将军在接受电台采访时表示，他没有受伤，并且他不相信中国知道他在船上。但马尼拉已召见北京大使，并对中国所谓“对和平、良好秩序和安全构成威胁”的“侵略”行为提出外交抗议。

China's foreign ministry said on Monday it has lodged solemn representations and a strong protest with the Philippine side over the collision it blamed on Manila, which has accused Beijing of spreading false narratives.

WHY IS THIS SIGNIFICANT FOR BOTH SIDES?

China's repeated attempts to blockade the Second Thomas Shoal, located less than 200 nautical miles from Philipines' province of Palawan, has made the submerged reef a flashpoint for conflict between Manila and Beijing.翻译:中国一再试图封锁距离菲律宾巴拉望省不到200海里的仁爱礁，使这片暗礁成为马尼拉和北京之间冲突的导火索。

Philippine officials and security experts fear Beijing is plotting to take over the shoal and militarise it as it did with Mischief Reef, which lies just 25 miles from the shoal.翻译:菲律宾官员和安全专家担心，北京正密谋接管该浅滩并将其军事化，就像对待距该浅滩仅 25 英里的美济礁那样。

"The shoal is a good site for a military base and China has the money to turn it into one," said Jonathan Malaya, a senior official at the Philippines' National Security Council. "That's why they wanted it."翻译:菲律宾国家安全委员会高级官员乔纳森·马拉亚表示：“该浅滩是建立军事基地的好地点，中国有资金将其建成军事基地。” “这就是他们想要它的原因。”

China, which has deployed vessels to patrol there, has repeatedly called on the Philippines to tow away the ship based on what it says was a "promise" made by Manila, but Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr denied such a pact existed. If there ever were such a deal, he was rescinding it, he said.翻译:中国派出船只在那里巡逻，并多次呼吁菲律宾根据马尼拉做出的“承诺”拖走这艘船，但菲律宾总统小费迪南德·马科斯否认存在这样的协议。他说，如果有这样的协议，他就会废除它。

Jay Batongbacal, a Manila-based expert on maritime law, has said Second Thomas Shoal is not only close to the Philippines, but is also close to the sea lines of communication passing through the Palawan passage, making it an ideal extension of Mischief Reef.

WHAT ARE THE RISKS IF THE TREND CONTINUES?

The latest confrontations are likely to further strain relations between the Philippines and Beijing, which have grown tense under Marcos. He has increasingly accused China of aggressive behaviour, while he has sought closer ties with the United States.翻译:最近的对抗可能会使菲律宾和北京之间的关系进一步紧张，两国在马科斯的领导下关系变得紧张。他越来越多地指责中国的侵略行为，同时寻求与美国建立更密切的关系。

But Justin Baquisal, National Security Analyst at FACTS Asia, thinks that would not affect the overall shape of high-level China-Philippines relations, since "a lot of the tit-for-tat on the South China Sea issue only happens at the ground-level."翻译:但FACTS Asia国家安全分析师贾斯汀·巴基萨尔认为，这不会影响中菲高层关系的整体形态，因为“南海问题上的很多针锋相对只发生在地面上” -等级。”

Philippine officials have also said that disputes in the South China Sea were not the sum of the country's relationship with China, which is among the Philippines' top trading partners.翻译:菲律宾官员还表示，南海争端并不是该国与中国关系的总和，中国是菲律宾最大的贸易伙伴之一。

Marcos has also kept the conversations with his Chinese counterpart going, and at the sidelines of an economic summit in San Francisco last month he and President Xi met to formulate ways forward in the South China Sea.翻译:马科斯还与中国同行保持对话，上个月在旧金山举行的经济峰会期间，他与习近平主席会面，制定了南海问题的前进方向。

Writing by Karen Lema and Kay Johnson, Editing by Angus MacSwan翻译:作者：Karen Lema 和 Kay Johnson，编辑：Angus MacSwan

item.title: 军政府发言人：缅甸军方在中国的帮助下镇压反叛组织
item.description:
Representatives from Myanmar's ruling military have held talks, facilitated by China, with three armed rebel groups leading an anti-junta offensive, state media reported a junta spokesperson as saying on Monday.翻译:据官方媒体报道，军政府发言人周一表示，在中国的推动下，缅甸执政军队的代表已与领导反军政府攻势的三个武装叛乱组织举行了会谈。

Myanmar's military is battling armed opponents on several fronts, in the fiercest challenge to its grip on the Southeast Asian country since it seized power from an elected government in a 2021 coup.翻译:缅甸军方正在多条战线上与武装反对派作战，这是自 2021 年政变中从民选政府手中夺取政权以来，对其对这个东南亚国家控制力的最激烈挑战。

Rebel groups aligned with a pro-democracy parallel government launched a coordinated offensive in late October, taking control of several military posts and towns near the border with China in the north and in western states.翻译:与支持民主的平行政府结盟的反叛组织于10月下旬发起了协调一致的攻势，控制了北部和西部各州与中国接壤的多个军事哨所和城镇。

"Myanmar's National Unity and Peacemaking Coordination Committee met with representatives of MNDAA, TNLA and AA with the help of China," said Zaw Min Tun, according to MRTV's Telegram channel, referring to the armed ethnic groups spearheading the offensive.翻译:据 MRTV 的 Telegram 频道报道，佐敏吞 (Zaw Min Tun) 表示：“在中国的帮助下，缅甸民族团结与和平协调委员会会见了民族民主同盟军、德军和若开军的代表。”他指的是带头攻势的武装少数民族团体。

"Based on the development of the conversation, there will likely be another meeting at the end of this month."翻译:“根据对话的进展，本月底可能会再次举行会议。”

It was unclear when or where the meeting took place and Zaw Min Tun did not elaborate on what was discussed.翻译:目前尚不清楚会议何时何地举行，Zaw Min Tun 也没有详细说明讨论的内容。

Representatives of the three rebel groups did not immediately respond to Reuters' request for comment. Chinese officials could not immediately be reached for comment.翻译:三个反叛组织的代表没有立即回应路透社的置评请求。未能立即联系到中国官员置评。

The statement comes as fighting continues across two-thirds of the country, killing more than 360 civilians and displacing more than half a million, according to the United Nations.翻译:据联合国称，该声明发表之际，该国三分之二地区的战斗仍在继续，造成 360 多名平民死亡，超过 50 万人流离失所。

item.title: 2023年，大胆的电动汽车战略遭遇现实打击
item.description:
This was the year the auto industry's race toward an all-electric future took a detour.翻译:今年，汽车行业迈向全电动未来的竞赛出现了弯路。

Heading into 2023, automakers were gearing up to invest $1.2 trillion by 2030 to move electric vehicles from niche products to mass-market models - many with batteries and software developed in-house, according to a Reuters analysis.翻译:据路透社分析，进入 2023 年，汽车制造商准备在 2030 年之前投资 1.2 万亿美元，将电动汽车从小众产品转向大众市场车型，其中许多车型配备内部开发的电池和软件。

As the year closes, legacy automakers as well as Tesla (TSLA.O), Rivian (RIVN.O) and other EV startups are throttling back investments and reworking product strategies. Legacy automakers are appealing to policymakers for more help to offset the high costs of the EV transition, on top of billions of dollars already pumped into EV subsidies.翻译:随着年底，传统汽车制造商以及特斯拉(TSLA.O) 、Rivian (RIVN.O)和其他电动汽车初创公司都在缩减投资并重新制定产品战略。除了已经投入电动汽车补贴的数十亿美元之外，传统汽车制造商还呼吁政策制定者提供更多帮助，以抵消电动汽车转型的高昂成本。

Consumer demand for EVs is growing worldwide. But EV adoption is not happening as fast or as profitably as industry executives anticipated, especially in the United States.翻译:全球消费者对电动汽车的需求正在增长。但电动汽车的采用并没有像行业高管预期的那么快或盈利，尤其是在美国。

High interest rates have pushed many EVs out of reach for middle-income consumers. Lack of charging infrastructure is a deal-breaker for buyers used to adding hundreds of miles of gasoline driving range in just a few minutes.翻译:高利率使中等收入消费者无法购买许多电动汽车。对于习惯在短短几分钟内增加数百英里汽油行驶里程的买家来说，缺乏充电基础设施是一个大问题。

"EVs are going to be the future of the passenger automobile business," said Jeff Parent, COO of AutoNation (AN.N), the U.S. auto dealership chain. But because of consumer concerns about price and charging, he said, "the next three to four years, things are going to be bumpy."翻译:美国汽车经销商连锁店 AutoNation (AN.N)首席运营官杰夫·帕伦特 (Jeff Parent) 表示：“电动汽车将成为乘用车行业的未来。”但由于消费者对价格和收费的担忧，他表示，“未来三到四年，事情将会变得崎岖不平。”

Industry CEOs are amplifying hedges on their goals of shifting to all-electric fleets by the middle of the next decade.翻译:行业首席执行官们正在加大对在下一个十年中期转向全电动车队的目标的对冲力度。

"We’ll adjust to where the customer is," General Motors (GM.N) CEO Mary Barra told the Detroit Automotive Press Association earlier this month when asked if GM still aims to be all-electric by 2035.翻译:本月早些时候，当被问及通用汽车是否仍计划到 2035 年实现全电动化时，通用汽车(GM.N)首席执行官玛丽·巴拉 (Mary Barra) 向底特律汽车新闻协会表示：“我们将根据客户的情况进行调整。”

THE F-150 LIGHTNING: HIGH HOPES, THEN DISAPPOINTMENT翻译:F-150 闪电：满怀希望，然后失望

Ford's (F.N) F-150 Lightning electric truck shows how bullish forecasts got corralled.翻译:福特(FN)的 F-150 Lightning 电动卡车展示了乐观的预测是如何被整合起来的。

Buoyed by enthusiastic early demand for the Lightning, Ford in August added a third work crew at its historic Rouge assembly complex in Dearborn, Michigan, to triple the production rate of the electric pickup truck to 150,000 vehicles a year.翻译:受到早期对 Lightning 的热烈需求的推动，福特于 8 月在其位于密歇根州迪尔伯恩历史悠久的 Rouge 装配厂增加了第三个工作人员，将电动皮卡车的生产率提高了两倍，达到每年 15 万辆。

But in October, Ford cancelled the third shift, conceding that demand for electric F-150s was not enough to sustain the planned production pace. About 700 workers were furloughed.翻译:但 10 月份， 福特取消了第三班，承认对电动 F-150 的需求不足以维持计划的生产速度。大约700名工人被迫休假。

In China, Europe and the United States - the main EV markets - electric-vehicle demand is still growing faster than demand for vehicles overall.翻译:在中国、欧洲和美国这些主要电动汽车市场，电动汽车需求的增长速度仍然快于汽车整体需求的增长速度。

Global EV production is on track to triple by 2030 to 33.4 million vehicles, about a third of total production, according to AutoForecast Solutions. Much of that growth will happen in China, where government subsidies and a price war led by Chinese EV market leader BYD (002594.SZ) and Tesla are making EVs more affordable than combustion vehicles, according to an analysis by JATO Dynamics.翻译:据 AutoForecast Solutions 称，到 2030 年，全球电动汽车产量有望增加两倍，达到 3340 万辆，约占总产量的三分之一。 JATO Dynamics 的分析显示，其中大部分增长将发生在中国，政府补贴以及中国电动汽车市场领导者比亚迪（002594.SZ）和特斯拉主导的价格战使电动汽车比燃油汽车更便宜。

In North America, production of battery-electric vehicles could increase sixfold to nearly 7 million vehicles by 2030, according to AFS. That is equivalent to roughly 40% of the projected U.S. market - but well short of the Biden administration's goals.

LOBBYING FOR RELIEF

Industry executives are lobbying the Biden administration to back away from emissions rules that effectively require EVs to account for two-thirds of U.S. new-vehicle sales by 2032.翻译:行业高管正在游说拜登政府放弃排放规定，该规定实际上要求到 2032 年电动汽车占美国新车销量的三分之二。

Looking ahead, industry executives raise two concerns about the challenge of expanding the EV market beyond adventurous early adopters of technology: Affordability and access to charging.翻译:展望未来，行业高管对将电动汽车市场扩展到敢于冒险的技术早期采用者之外的挑战提出了两个担忧：负担能力和充电机会。

The slow pace of charging infrastructure development forced major legacy automakers to cut deals this year with Tesla to allow buyers of their EVs to use Tesla's Supercharger network - a competitive coup for Tesla.翻译:充电基础设施发展缓慢，迫使主要传统汽车制造商今年与特斯拉达成协议，允许其电动汽车购买者使用特斯拉的超级充电网络——这对特斯拉来说是一个有竞争力的妙招。

"The automakers' capitulation to the (Tesla) standard is a clear signal that they are realizing that demand is held back by fears on charging," said Mark Wakefield, co-leader of consultancy AlixPartners' automotive practice.翻译:咨询公司 AlixPartners 汽车业务联合负责人马克·韦克菲尔德 (Mark Wakefield) 表示：“汽车制造商对特斯拉标准的屈服是一个明确的信号，表明他们意识到需求因对充电的担忧而受到抑制。”

"Affordability" is industry code for convincing mainstream, middle-income consumers to pay enough for an EV to cover higher production costs and still yield a profit. For most legacy automakers, that has so far proven impossible.翻译:“可负担性”是说服主流中等收入消费者支付足够的价格购买电动汽车的行业代码，以覆盖更高的生产成本并仍然产生利润。对于大多数传统汽车制造商来说，迄今为止这被证明是不可能的。

Even Tesla, which makes money on EVs, has been forced to cut prices to keep assembly lines running at full speed in China and the United States.翻译:即使是靠电动汽车赚钱的特斯拉也被迫降价，以保持中国和美国装配线的全速运转。

"If our car cost the same as a (Toyota (7203.T)) RAV4, no one would buy a RAV4, or, at least, they would be very unlikely to," Tesla CEO Elon Musk told analysts in October. “Our car is still much more expensive than a RAV4."翻译:“如果我们的汽车成本与（丰田（7203.T） ）RAV4 相同，那么没有人会购买 RAV4，或者至少他们不太可能购买，”特斯拉首席执行官埃隆·马斯克 (Elon Musk) 在 10 月份对分析师表示。 “我们的车还是比 RAV4 贵很多。”

RAV4 models start at $28,475. Model Y's start at $43,990, and until Dec. 31 come with $7,500 tax credits. Tesla has warned those credits could be reduced as tougher domestic content rules kick in.翻译:RAV4 车型起价为 28,475 美元。 Model Y 起价为 43,990 美元，12 月 31 日之前可享受 7,500 美元的税收抵免。特斯拉警告称，随着更严格的国内含量规则的实施，这些积分可能会减少。

Reporting by Joe White in Detroit Editing by Matthew Lewis翻译:乔·怀特在底特律的报道 马修·刘易斯编辑

item.title: 习近平访问期间，中国向越南提供铁路援助，推动数字丝绸之路
item.description:
China and Vietnam are set to agree this week on upgraded rail links and other infrastructure, possibly including digital projects, officials said, in moves that would bring Hanoi closer to Beijing as great powers jostle for influence in Vietnam.翻译:官员们表示，中国和越南将于本周就升级铁路和其他基础设施（可能包括数字项目）达成一致，此举将使河内与北京更加接近，因为大国都在争夺对越南的影响力。

The announcements are expected during President Xi Jinping's visit to Hanoi from Tuesday, the first in six years to the Southeast Asian neighbour, and shortly after U.S. President Joe Biden travelled to the Vietnamese capital in September to strengthen bilateral ties.翻译:预计这些消息将在习近平主席周二访问河内期间宣布，这是六年来首次访问这个东南亚邻国，也是在美国总统乔·拜登于 9 月访问越南首都以加强双边关系后不久。

China is ready to offer grants to Vietnam to boost the railway between Kunming and the Vietnamese port city of Haiphong, and other transport links from southern China to Hanoi, Vietnamese state paper Tuoi Tre reported, citing the Chinese ambassador to Vietnam Xiong Bo.翻译:越南官方报纸《Tuoi Tre》援引中国驻越南大使熊波的话说，中国准备向越南提供赠款，以加强昆明和越南港口城市海防之间的铁路建设，以及从中国南部到河内的其他交通联系。

He said China was ready to provide "non-refundable aid" for these projects, the paper reported late on Sunday, in an offer that, if confirmed, would represent a major concession to a country that is traditionally loath of taking loans.翻译:该报周日晚间报道称，他表示中国已准备好为这些项目提供“不可退还的援助”，这一提议如果得到确认，将是对一个传统上不愿接受贷款的国家的重大让步。

It is however unclear whether grants would come with loans and the share of both.翻译:然而，尚不清楚赠款是否会与贷款一起提供以及两者的份额。

A sizeable offer of grants could also be perceived as a blow to the United States and other Western backers of infrastructure projects in Vietnam, who under a climate plan have offered mostly loans at market values to help Vietnam reduce its coal use.翻译:提供大量赠款也可能被视为对美国和越南基础设施项目的其他西方支持者的打击，根据气候计划，这些国家主要以市场价值提供贷款，以帮助越南减少煤炭使用。

The Kunming-Haiphong rail upgrade plan, which Reuters first reported earlier in December, passes through the region where Vietnam has its biggest rare earths mines, which it has so far been unable to exploit because of a lack of processing technology.翻译:路透社12月初首次报道的昆明至海防铁路升级计划经过越南拥有最大稀土矿的地区，但由于缺乏加工技术，越南迄今为止无法开采该矿。

Vietnam is estimated to hold the world's second largest deposits of the strategic minerals which are at the moment crucial for electric vehicles and wind turbines.翻译:据估计，越南拥有世界第二大战略矿产资源，目前对电动汽车和风力涡轮机至关重要。

China is by far the world's biggest producer and refiner of rare earths, but is unclear what deal could be reached on that, as Beijing is usually reluctant to share its refining technology and Hanoi largely prevents export of unprocessed rare earths.翻译:中国是迄今为止世界上最大的稀土生产国和精炼国，但尚不清楚能就此达成什么协议，因为北京通常不愿分享其精炼技术，而河内则在很大程度上阻止未加工稀土的出口。

Vietnam's foreign affairs ministry did not reply on Monday to a request for comment about the possible grants, but Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh in November supported the upgrade of the Kunming-Haiphong rail.

DIGITAL SILK ROAD

China's ambassador also mentioned digital interconnections among the priorities to strengthen cooperation between the two countries, which are already enjoying booming economic exchanges.翻译:中国大使还提到，数字互联是两国加强合作的优先事项之一，两国经济交流已经蓬勃发展。

"Both of our countries need to enhance interconnections on land, sea, air and on the internet," Xiong Bo was reported saying.翻译:据报道，熊波表示：“我们两国都需要加强陆地、海洋、空中和互联网上的互联互通。”

Diplomats, officials and Vietnamese experts said digital interconnections meant including Vietnam in Chinese plans for a Digital Silk Road, Beijing's flagship programme under the wider Belt and Road Initiative focussed on optical fibre cables, data centres and other telecoms infrastructure in friendly countries.翻译:外交官、官员和越南专家表示，数字互联意味着将越南纳入中国的数字丝绸之路计划，这是北京在更广泛的“一带一路”倡议下的旗舰计划，重点关注友好国家的光纤电缆、数据中心和其他电信基础设施。

Additional submarine cables could be part of the discussion, one diplomat said, as Vietnam has experienced disruptions this year in its undersea digital infrastructure. Vietnam also plans to build a fully-fledged 5G network, an infrastructure in which China's telecom giant Huawei excels.翻译:一位外交官表示，由于越南今年的海底数字基础设施出现中断，因此可能会讨论增加海底电缆。越南还计划建设成熟的5G网络，这是中国电信巨头华为擅长的基础设施。

Vietnam's foreign ministry did not comment on Monday but President Vo Van Thuong at the Belt and Road forum in China in October urged to boost cooperation on digital infrastructure.翻译:越南外交部周一没有发表评论，但越南国家主席武文上在 10 月份中国“一带一路”论坛上敦促加强数字基础设施合作。

It is however unclear whether Vietnam is only paying lip service to that, as national security concerns tend to prevail on strategic projects, said Le Hong Hiep, a senior fellow at Singapore's Iseas–Yusof Ishak Institute, especially in the South China Sea, where Hanoi and Beijing disagree over borders.翻译:然而，新加坡尤索夫伊萨研究所高级研究员 Le Hong Hiep 表示，目前还不清楚越南是否只是口头上说说而已，因为国家安全问题往往在战略项目上占主导地位，特别是在南中国海，河内和北京在边界问题上存在分歧。

Reporting by Francesco Guarascio and Khanh Vu; Editing by Michael Perry翻译:Francesco Guarascio 和 Khanh Vu 的报道；迈克尔·佩里编辑

item.title: 香港“只有爱国者”选举表现平平，投票率创历史新低
item.description:
A "patriots only" district election in Hong Kong that barred opposition democrats from the ballot sheet amid a national security squeeze had a record low voter turnout of 27.5% as many voters spurned what was seen as an undemocratic poll.翻译:在国家安全压力下，香港举行的“仅限爱国者”区选举禁止反对派民主党人参与投票，投票率创历史新低，仅为 27.5%，因为许多选民拒绝接受被视为不民主的民意调查。

The sharp slide in turnout since the last such election in 2019 comes after Beijing imposed a sweeping national security law that has been used to clamp down on dissent, and overhauled the electoral system to shut out democrats and other liberals.翻译:自2019年上次此类选举以来，投票率大幅下滑，此前北京实施了一项全面的国家安全法，该法用于压制异见，并彻底改革了选举制度以将民主党人和其他自由派人士拒之门外。

"It can be seen that everyone has begun to feel that the election has no meaning," said Lemon Wong, one of the few remaining democrats still involved in local politics.翻译:“可以看出，每个人都开始觉得选举没有意义，”仅存的少数仍参与当地政治的民主党人之一莱蒙·黄(Lemon Wong)说。

"Even pro-establishment supporters are asking themselves why they need to vote because it's all the same."翻译:“即使是建制派的支持者也在问自己为什么需要投票，因为都是一样的。”

The previous lowest turnout was 35.8% in 1999. Four years ago at the last such election during Hong Kong's mass pro-democracy protests, a record 71% turnout brought about a landslide victory for the democratic camp in a fiercely contested poll.翻译:此前的最低投票率是1999年的35.8%。四年前，在香港大规模民主抗议期间的最后一次此类选举中，创纪录的71%投票率在一场激烈的民意调查中为民主阵营带来了压倒性胜利。

For this election, directly elected seats were slashed by nearly 80%, while all candidates were required to undergo national security background checks and secure nominations from two pro-government committees.翻译:这次选举，直选席位被削减近80%，所有候选人都必须接受国家安全背景调查，并获得两个亲政府委员会的提名。

At least three pro-democracy and non pro-establishment groups, including moderates, and even some pro-Beijing figures failed to meet those thresholds.翻译:至少三个亲民主和非建制派团体，包括温和派，甚至一些亲北京人士未能达到这些门槛。

An unprecedented electronic poll register system failure caused some disruptions and an eventual switch to a manual system, with polling times extended by 90 minutes till midnight.翻译:前所未有的电子投票登记系统故障造成了一些干扰，最终切换到手动系统，投票时间延长了 90 分钟，直到午夜。

The electoral commission said the extension wasn't linked at all to the turnout rate.翻译:选举委员会表示，延期与投票率完全无关。

Security was tight, with over ten thousand police deployed. At least six people were arrested for alleged offences including posting online for people to cast invalid ballots, or to incite others to disrupt the polls, according to statements from the police and the city's anti-corruption authority.

"BIRDCAGE" ELECTION

Three members of the "League of Social Democrats" were among those followed and arrested just before they planned to protest against what they described as a "birdcage election" and a "big leap backwards" for electoral and democratic rights.翻译:“社会民主党联盟”的三名成员在计划抗议他们所说的“鸟笼选举”以及选举和民主权利的“大倒退”之前遭到跟踪和逮捕。

The police said in a statement the three were arrested on suspicion of attempting to "incite others" to disrupt the poll.翻译:警方在一份声明中表示，三人因涉嫌试图“煽动他人”扰乱投票而被捕。

Hong Kong's leader John Lee, who had sought in recent weeks to rally public support for the polls, again defended their legitimacy given a need to secure stability in Hong Kong that returned from British to Chinese rule in 1997.翻译:香港领导人李家超最近几周一直在寻求争取公众对这次民意调查的支持，鉴于需要确保1997年从英国回归中国统治的香港的稳定，他再次捍卫了民意调查的合法性。

"It is the last piece of the puzzle for us to implement the principles of patriots governing Hong Kong," Lee said after casting his vote. He added that the 2019 election had been used to sabotage governance and endanger national security.翻译:李在投票后表示：“这是我们落实爱国者治港原则的最后一块拼图。”他补充说，2019 年选举被用来破坏治理并危害国家安全。

While some western governments have been critical of Hong Kong's authoritarian turn under the national security law, China says it has brought stability to the financial hub after protracted pro-democracy protests in 2019.翻译:尽管一些西方政府一直批评香港根据国家安全法转向独裁，但中国表示，在 2019 年旷日持久的民主抗议活动之后，该法为这个金融中心带来了稳定。

Reporting by Edward Cho, Dorothy Kam, Jessie Pang and James Pomfret; writing by James Pomfret; Editing by Sonali Paul翻译:Edward Cho、Dorothy Kam、Jessie Pang 和 James Pomfret 报道；詹姆斯·庞弗雷特 (James Pomfret) 撰写；索纳利·保罗编辑
